content.description: Start on the slightly overhanging wall with good holds. Mantle over into easier terrain and go straight up the anchor.
The stiffer, direct start of Fissure Man. Climb on the overhanging right wall in the crevice between that and the hueco slab.  A fall at the start could easily swing you into the slab.
content.protection: Good bolts, but falling during the first couple clips would most likely not be a clean fall.
content.location: Start on the overhanging wall to the right of the hueco slab.  This is the start to Waterworld.

content.description: The most obvious line on the wall.  Start up the hueco slab start to the overhang.  Work around this to get to the extremely sharp edges on the lower half of the crack. A few more moves and you can get a couple jams in the feces incrusted, jagged crack above.  This leads to the final headwall, which involves face climbing around various heucos that serve as homes to the birds that you have to thank for the glorious crack climbing below.  Good times!
content.location: Can't miss it, look for the crack.  The climb technically starts on the hueco slabbish section.  The bolted overhanging section to the right is another climb (Water world), or the direct start to this climb (Waterboy)
